analysis.Summary: Socials.vue — Vue component that renders a row of social media icons as links. It accepts various social network handles as props, builds full URLs, and displays only the networks for which a prop value is provided.
analysis.Purpose: To provide a reusable block of social media links/icons for an organization or user profile within the Martyrs framework project.

Components.name: Socials
responsibilities: Define props for each supported social network handle
Compute an array of active social links (name + URL)
Resolve and render the corresponding icon component

Functions.name: socialLinks
Functions.description: Filters the supported network list by truthy prop values and maps each into an object with `name` and full `href` URL.

Functions.name: resolveSocialIcon
Functions.description: Given a network name, returns the corresponding icon component or null if unsupported.

analysis.Usage: Import and embed `<Socials>` in a parent component, passing handles as props. E.g.: `<Socials telegram="myChannel" facebook="myPage" />`. Only non-empty props result in rendered icons.
Notes: No `<style>` block is defined; relies on global or utility CSS classes.
Networks with empty `base` (e.g. Line) will produce a raw href if provided.
Unused import: `resolveComponent` is imported but not used.
Icon resolution is static—extending networks requires updating both the `networks` array and the `icons` map.
